page.title: 04Braithwell Church
page.content: St. James' Church, built of sandstone and limestone, dates from late Saxon times.The following additions have been made;arches in 1200, a south aisle in the 14th century a Perpendicular-style Tower in the 15th century, pews in 1821, which were renewed in 1894, an Organ was installed in 1844, a new Chancel in 1845 and an oak eagle Lectern in 1890. The Pulpit, dated 1907, incorporates original Elizabethan carved panels. Extensions of land given by the Earl of Scarbrough were made to the South in 1908 and East in 1969. In 1932, a carved Altar and an octagonal Font were added and electricity installed. The Vestry Screen(1947) was made by the 'Mouseman of Kilburn'.The Fleur de Lys motifs either side of the Altar suggest that the mosaic floor may be the original Norman floor.
